description: T4552 Caucasian Maple Prune from adjacent structure to clear lamp column by 1 m.T4514 Robinia Prune from adjacent structure to clear lamp column by 1 m.T4530 London Plane reduce all extended lateral limbs by 2.5 - 3 m in the lower, mid and upper outer sections of the crown, tapering in to meet the current top centre of the crownT7481Red Horse Chestnut Reduce heavy branch weight reducing the main terminal section of the subdominant stem/ limb to the west attached at 4 m byapproximately 2.5 m, to prevent failure onto pedestrians, due to it being heavily suppressed and extended over the footpath. The secondarybranches growing from the limb should be lightly pruned by up to 1.5 m to balance the shape of the crown an produce a natural aesthetic.T4529 London PlaneReduce faulted stem / stems by - Specified extent (stem to the southeast which has 2 obvious woodpecker holes at approximately 8m and several decayed pruning wounds throughout. Stem previously weight reduced but now regrown). Re-reduce stem by around 2.5 m tothe most recent, previous pruning points to minimise loading on weakened stem. Additionally, reduce the two heavily leaning stems to thenortheast overhanging the children's playground, by around 2.5 m, due to heavy extension growth observed and to prevent failure due to achange in the crown/ wind dynamics, following the reduction of the southeast stem. Final cuts to be no greater than 100 mm diameter, leavingfurnishing growth to minimise visual impact
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
